alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 1:58PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coconino County through 230 PM MST... At 157 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bitter Springs, or 21 miles southwest of Page, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized flooding is possible. Locations impacted include... Bitter Springs, Antelope Creek Basin and Waterholes Canyon. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 518 and 541. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 524 and 531. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Black Mesa Area; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward
